item.title: StyleSheet Bugs
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“Koolvin, post:76, topic:336998”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=433408.msg3187894#msg3187894 date=1271960560]

[quote author=xx matty xx link=topic=433408.msg3187659#msg3187659 date=1271918469]

[quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=433408.msg3187561#msg3187561 date=1271904908]

[quote author=abraham2119 link=topic=433408.msg3187539#msg3187539 date=1271902689]
it had to be said though
[/quote]No it didn’t.

I had said nothing wrong, and whatever they started arguing with me over was purely opinionated.

The only contributions YOU have made to the thread were flame, and I was the first one to answer the question.
[/quote]i believe that the last few pages have just been about how you were wrong, because there is an IE variation of CSS.

if you don’t know what you’re talking about, you shouldn’t be posting. if you say something invalid, it’s good that you’re corrected so we actually learn properly and don’t go around remembering peoples bullshit.
[/quote]I know there are differences between the CSS used in IE and other browsers, and the only thing I said was that it’s not called ‘IE CSS’, and that they are the same language. People just assumed that meant that I thought there was no variation, and started arguing about it. Even when I told them that I knew that there were differences but still the same language we just started arguing about the name…
[/quote]And you were completely wrong. Also you came off and said there’s no difference between IE CSS and Opera/Firefox/Chrome/Safari CSS which was wrong. You also implied that Opera, Firefox, Chroma, and Safari have the same CSS, which is wrong as well.[/quote]When did I say that there is no difference? I think that I said the opposite you clueles moron… And I also said that I know about the differences between browsers, and the ONLY thing I was arguing about was the label people slap onto it.

I can quote at least 4 posts in this topic that show your cluelessness and stupidity if you want me to.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“Koolvin, post:69, topic:336998”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=433408.msg3187416#msg3187416 date=1271893899]

[quote author=Koolvin link=topic=433408.msg3187383#msg3187383 date=1271890946]

[quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=433408.msg3187326#msg3187326 date=1271888429]

This thread was derailed as soon as you posted Davidi2.
[/quote]Are you trying to start another argument? My first post in this thread:

Have you tried using DocType’s in your HTML pages? I have known a few cases where absolute positioning and table layouts fuck up if you put incorrectly or leave out the correct doctype.

[/quote]You’re arguing the validity of your posts in attempt to prove that you don’t derail the topic. Is this topic about the validity of your posts?
[/quote]No it isn’t, but someone else derailed it into that topic. If you know what derailed means…
[/quote]You are obviously a moron.[/quote]I’m not the one that tried to argue that me replying to someone means that I derailed the topic.

This:[quote=“Unhandled, post:31, topic:336998”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=433408.msg3185630#msg3185630 date=1271709047]
There is no such thing as ‘IE’ CSS… the language is the same.

If you don’t know what you are talking about don’t post.

You’re a fucking retard, how about you stop posting.[/quote]
Was the first non web-design related reply.

item.title: StyleSheet Bugs
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

[quote=“abraham2119, post:59, topic:336998”]i never said that the definition you posted was inaccurate, i said that you have to bear in mind that sometimes definitions are not completely accurate, thus explaining why they are not always transitable to whatever context you are implementing it into (ie in this case)

yes, the definition was from there, and if by ‘clipped’ you mean not pasting that entire sentence, i must say…you are dumber than i thought. most dictionaries give you separate definitions or additional content to that definition - which isn’t always applicable - separated by comas, and seeing how the concatenated definition didn’t apply in this case, i gave you the ‘clipped’ one

and in case that source isn’t ‘reputable’ enough for you, take a look at a thesaurus:
http://thesaurus.com/browse/under+developed

[quote]Definition: stupid; not thought through
Synonyms: backward, batty, birdbrained, blockheaded, boneheaded, brainless, crazy, dumb, feeble-minded, foolish, harebrained, idiotic, ignorant, ill-conceived, imbecilic, impractical, indiscreet, moronic, poorly planned, [size=30pt]retarded[/size], senseless, short-sighted, silly, slow, sophomoric, underdeveloped, unformed, witless
[/quote][/quote]
haha the synonyms are awesome

Read full topic

item.title: StyleSheet Bugs
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

[quote=“abraham2119, post:59, topic:336998”]i never said that the definition you posted was inaccurate, i said that you have to bear in mind that sometimes definitions are not completely accurate, thus explaining why they are not always transitable to whatever context you are implementing it into (ie in this case)

yes, the definition was from there, and if by ‘clipped’ you mean not pasting that entire sentence, i must say…you are dumber than i thought. most dictionaries give you separate definitions or additional content to that definition - which isn’t always applicable - separated by comas, and seeing how the concatenated definition didn’t apply in this case, i gave you the ‘clipped’ one

and in case that source isn’t ‘reputable’ enough for you, take a look at a thesaurus:
http://thesaurus.com/browse/under+developed

[quote]Definition: stupid; not thought through
Synonyms: backward, batty, birdbrained, blockheaded, boneheaded, brainless, crazy, dumb, feeble-minded, foolish, harebrained, idiotic, ignorant, ill-conceived, imbecilic, impractical, indiscreet, moronic, poorly planned, [size=30pt]retarded[/size], senseless, short-sighted, silly, slow, sophomoric, underdeveloped, unformed, witless
[/quote][/quote]
The reason why I asked about if it was clipped was because you ignored the parenthetical psychology (the context that it is meant for), not for the part following the comma.
A thesaurus lists synonyms, the words aren’t the same.
I understand slang usage of ‘retarded’ is applicable, but the point I meant was that by the definition I provided, it’s not. I don’t really think all of this is necessary - we seem to be agreeing with each other for the most part.

Read full topic

i never said that the definition you posted was inaccurate, i said that you have to bear in mind that sometimes definitions are not completely accurate, thus explaining why they are not always transitable to whatever context you are implementing it into (ie in this case)

yes, the definition was from there, and if by ‘clipped’ you mean not pasting that entire sentence, i must say…you are dumber than i thought. most dictionaries give you separate definitions or additional content to that definition - which isn’t always applicable - separated by comas, and seeing how the concatenated definition didn’t apply in this case, i gave you the ‘clipped’ one

and in case that source isn’t ‘reputable’ enough for you, take a look at a thesaurus:
http://thesaurus.com/browse/under+developed

Definition: stupid; not thought through Synonyms: backward, batty, birdbrained, blockheaded, boneheaded, brainless, crazy, dumb, feeble-minded, foolish, harebrained, idiotic, ignorant, ill-conceived, imbecilic, impractical, indiscreet, moronic, poorly planned, [size=30pt][b]retarded[/b][/size], senseless, short-sighted, silly, slow, sophomoric, underdeveloped, unformed, witless

item.title: StyleSheet Bugs
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

[quote=“abraham2119, post:57, topic:336998”]clearly you are an illiterate turd who lacks the ability to comprehend a simple definition. first off, however, you should seek the competence required to understand that not all definitions are accurate and are not always transitable to the context of your pleasing. obviously, the context the definition itself was referring to was in the case where that adjective is used to describe a person, or any living thing for that matter

since web definitions seem to attract you, how about making a more thorough search before jumping on anyone who uses a word pertaining to a language to which its grammatical basis are unknown to you

retarded [rɪˈtɑːdɪd]
adj
underdeveloped[/quote]
I’m fairly certain that the Oxford English Dictionary is considered a reputable and accurate source for definitions. The one I provided was from the Compact Oxford English Dictionary. And yes, the context of the definition was that it was meant to be applied to people - that was my point. I am fairly certain that I did indeed comprehend the definition - I am not trying to flame, but you seem to be only furthering my point - the definition isn’t applicable to this context.
Did you clip that definition?

retarded [rɪˈtɑːdɪd] adj (Psychology) underdeveloped, esp mentally and esp having an IQ of 70 to 85
http://www.thefreedictionary.com/retarded If not, where did you get that definition from? Are they considered a reputable source?

Read full topic

item.title: StyleSheet Bugs
item.dc:creator: @abraham2119 abraham2119
item.description:
@abraham2119 wrote:

[quote=“cooper, post:55, topic:336998”][quote author=abraham2119 link=topic=433408.msg3186477#msg3186477 date=1271804258]

retarded
• adjective less advanced in mental, physical, or social development than is usual for one’s age.
Not applicable to posts.
[/quote]umm did you skip preschool grammar? “retarded” is an adjective, hence it can be used to describe a noun (“post”)

now quit spewing retarded posts

So posts have mental, physical or social development? Even more, you’re suggesting that they have standards for this development at certain ages?
A post can display how a poster is claimed to be retarded, but the post itself cannot be retarded.[/quote]clearly you are an illiterate turd who lacks the ability to comprehend a simple definition. first off, however, you should seek the competence required to understand that not all definitions are accurate and are not always transitable to the context of your pleasing. obviously, the context the definition itself was referring to was in the case where that adjective is used to describe a person, or any living thing for that matter

since web definitions seem to attract you, how about making a more thorough search before jumping on anyone who uses a word pertaining to a language to which its grammatical basis are unknown to you

retarded [rɪˈtɑːdɪd]
adj
underdeveloped

edit: hadnt realized the moron had posted:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:56, topic:336998”][quote author=cooper link=topic=433408.msg3186533#msg3186533 date=1271807495]

[quote author=abraham2119 link=topic=433408.msg3186477#msg3186477 date=1271804258]

retarded
• adjective less advanced in mental, physical, or social development than is usual for one’s age.
Not applicable to posts.
[/quote]umm did you skip preschool grammar? “retarded” is an adjective, hence it can be used to describe a noun (“post”)

now quit spewing retarded posts

So posts have mental, physical or social development? Even more, you’re suggesting that they have standards for this development at certain ages?
A post can display how a poster is claimed to be retarded, but the post itself cannot be retarded.
[/quote]And on the internet you can’t know if a poster is actually retarded or not.[/quote]… you can infer from all the posts the user makes whether he/she is knowledgable or a clueless fuck; you being a prime example for the latter

Read full topic
